void eol_mesh_load_config ()
 loads the eol_mesh configuration from file or loads defaults if no file found.
eolMesh * eol_mesh_new ()
 returns an pointer to usable internal mesh data. Data is zero set and reference count set to one.
void eol_mesh_free (eolMesh **mesh)
 frees the mesh data provided. Sets the pointer to NULL to prevent accidental access. Note that it merely decriments reference count for the mesh, as others may be using the same data. Actual freeing can be deferred.
eolGroup * eol_mesh_get_group_by_name (char *name, eolMesh *model)
 searches the mesh provided for the vertex group by the name.
eolMesh * eol_mesh_get_by_filename (char *filename)
eolMesh * eol_mesh_load (char *filename)
 loads mesh data from file. It will try to get the data from binary format first, if it is not available it will load from .obj. If not found, out of memory or other error it will return NULL.
eolGroup * eol_mesh_get_next_group_for_vert (eolFloat **weight, eolMesh *mesh, eolGroup *group, int vindex)
void eol_mesh_draw (eolMesh *mesh, eolVec3D position, eolVec3D rotation, eolVec3D scale, eolVec3D color, eolFloat alpha, eolSprite *skin)
 draws the provided mesh to the active draw buffer.

Definition at line 53 of file eol_mesh.c.

void eol_mesh_draw ( eolMesh *  mesh,
eolVec3D  position,
eolVec3D  rotation,
eolVec3D  scale,
eolVec3D  color,
eolFloat  alpha,
eolSprite *  skin 
)

draws the provided mesh to the active draw buffer.

Parameters:
mesh the mesh to draw
position the x,y,z position to draw it at
rotation the x,y,z rotation
scale the x,y,z scaling factor (1,1,1 is no scaling)
color the r,g,b color shifting factor. (1,1,1 is no color shift)
alpha the transparency to draw it with (1 is opaque, 0 is no drawing)
skin the loaded sprite to use as the texture.

draws the provided mesh to the active draw buffer.

Parameters:
mesh the mesh to draw
position the x,y,z position to draw it at
rotation the x,y,z rotation
scale the x,y,z scaling factor (1,1,1 is no scaling)
color the r,g,b color shifting factor. (1,1,1 is no color shift)
alpha the transparency to draw it with (1 is opaque, 0 is no drawing)

Definition at line 755 of file eol_mesh.c.

void eol_mesh_free ( eolMesh **  mesh  ) 

frees the mesh data provided. Sets the pointer to NULL to prevent accidental access. Note that it merely decriments reference count for the mesh, as others may be using the same data. Actual freeing can be deferred.

eolGroup* eol_mesh_get_group_by_name ( char *  name,
eolMesh *  mesh 
)

searches the mesh provided for the vertex group by the name.

Parameters:
name the name to search for.
mesh the mesh to search
Returns:
NULL if not found or error. a pointer to the vertex group in the mesh otherwise.

Definition at line 48 of file eol_mesh.c.

eolMesh* eol_mesh_load ( char *  filename  ) 

loads mesh data from file. It will try to get the data from binary format first, if it is not available it will load from .obj. If not found, out of memory or other error it will return NULL.

Parameters:
filename the path included filename, without the extension. It will automattically check for the .emesh or .obj files.
Returns:
the loaded mesh data or NULL on error.

Definition at line 543 of file eol_mesh.c.

Definition at line 169 of file eol_mesh.c.

eolMesh* eol_mesh_new (  ) 

returns an pointer to usable internal mesh data. Data is zero set and reference count set to one.

Returns:
a new useful mesh data structure or NULL if out of memory or other error.
